headline: Is Freeport McMoRan (FCX) Still Attractive After Its Strong Recent Share Price Run?
summary: Wondering if Freeport-McMoRan at around US$54.22 is still a fair entry point, or if the recent excitement has already been priced in? This article unpacks what that current price might mean for you. With the share price showing returns of 6.8% over 7 days, 21.0% over 30 days, 4.4% year to date, 38.5% over 1 year, 25.0% over 3 years and 81.1% over 5 years, many investors are asking whether the current level reflects opportunity, higher risk, or a bit of both. Recent attention on...

headline: Freeport-McMoRan (FCX) Is Up 6.8% After Copper Hits Record Highs Amid Grasberg Mine Scrutiny
summary: In recent days, benchmark copper futures in London briefly reached a record US$13,000 per ton amid mine outages and trade disruptions that raised concerns about global copper supply. This spike has put renewed focus on Freeport-McMoRan’s role as a major copper producer at a time when the metal is critical for power, construction, and electrification-related industries. While copper prices hit new highs on tight supply and strong demand, Freeport-McMoRan is simultaneously contending with...

headline: Prediction: This Undervalued Mining Stock's Earnings Will Soar in 2026
summary: The price of copper has surged recently, and this company is well placed to benefit from it in 2026.

headline: Oil Isn’t the Only Commodity at Play in the U.S. Ouster of Maduro
summary: Oil isn’t the only commodity to drive President Donald Trump’s decision to oust Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro.  The nation’s critical minerals shouldn’t be overlooked as a potential motive for regime change.  While oil gets the attention, the U.S. has plenty of it, perhaps too much.
